page.title: 13DIVING IN WOOKEY HOLE CAVES
page.content: CAVE DIVING AT WOOKEY HOLE DATES BACK TO 1935 WHEN THE 7TH. CHAMBER OF THE CAVES WAS EXPLORED BY A DIVER WEARING ROYAL NAVY DIVING GEAR. A COMMENTARY WAS GIVEN FOR THE B.B.C. SINCE THAT DATE,CONSIDERABLE EXPLORATION HAS TAKEN PLACE. NINE CHAMBERS ARE OPEN TO THE PUBLIC, BUT 25 HAVE BEEN INVESTIGATED BY CAVE DIVERS. IN JULY,1985, A DIVER FAILED TO REACH CHAMBER 26, OR TO DISCOVER THE SOURCE OF THE RIVER AXE,BUT SET A BRITISH RECORD WITH A DIVE OF 22O FEET,USING THE MOST MODERN EQUIPMENT. IN THE PAST,TWO DIVERS HAVE LOST THEIR LIVES;THOSE WILLING TO TAKE THE RISK ARE REWARDED BY THE DISCOVERY OF SUBTERRANEAN PASSAGES AND LARGE HALLS,MANY HUNDREDS OF FEET BENEATH THE MENDIP HILLS.
